maml:description.maml:para: Edit an Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan

The Edit-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan cmdlet lets you edit a Recovery Plan. Use this cmdlet to add or remove recovery plan groups or replication protected items to or from the recovery plan. This cmdlet edits a local copy of the recovery plan. Use the Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan cmdlet to save the changes to the Recovery Plan
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Switch to append a group to the Recovery Plan
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Switch parameter to remove a group from the Recovery Plan
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Recovery Plan group
List of Replication Protected Items to be added to the recovery plan
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Recovery Plan group
List of Protection Entities to be added to the recovery plan group
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Recovery Plan group
List of Protection Entities to be removed from the recovery plan.
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Recovery Plan group
List of Replication Protected Items to be removed from the recovery plan.
Azure Site Recovery Recovery Plan
Switch to append a group to the Recovery Plan
Switch parameter to remove a group from the Recovery Plan
Recovery Plan group
List of Replication Protected Items to be added to the recovery plan
List of Protection Entities to be added to the recovery plan group
List of Protection Entities to be removed from the recovery plan.
List of Replication Protected Items to be removed from the recovery plan.
Get the properties of an Azure Site Recovery Fabric
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryFabric cmdlet allows you to get the properties of a specified Azure Site Recovery Fabric or all Azure Site Recovery Fabrics in a Recovery Service vault.
Name of the Azure Site Recovery Fabric
Friendly name of the Azure Site Recovery Fabric
Name of the Azure Site Recovery Fabric
Friendly name of the Azure Site Recovery Fabric
Gets Azure Site Recovery jobs.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet gets Azure Site Recovery jobs.

Specifies a start time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that started after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.

Specifies a end time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that started before the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Filter results based on ID of the Azure Site Recovery object to which the Job applies.
Filter results based on Job state
Filter results by Job Name
Get update Job object for the specified Azure Site Recovery Job.

Specifies a start time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that started after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.

Specifies a end time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that started before the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Filter results based on ID of the Azure Site Recovery object to which the Job applies.
Filter results based on Job state
Filter results by Job Name
Get update Job object for the specified Azure Site Recovery Job.

Gets Protection Containers of the Azure Site Recovery vault. A Protection Container is a logical container for Protectable Items such as virtual machines. Protection policies define replication settings for Protected Items and can be associated to a Protection Container and applied to a Protectable Item while enabling protection.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionContainer cmdlet gets Azure Site Recovery Protection Containers in the vault.
Name of the Protection Container
Name of the Protection Container

Name of the Protection Container
Azure Site Recovery Fabric object.
Friendly name of the Protection Container.

Import an Azure Site Recovery vault settings file to set the current vault context for Azure Site Recovery PowerShell operations

The New-AzureRmSiteRecoveryNetworkMapping cmdlet creates a mapping between discovered VMM networks or between a VMM network and an Azure virtual network.

Creates an Azure Site Recovery replication policy. The replication policy is used to specify replication settings such as replication frequency, number of recovery points etc.
The New-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicy cmdlet creates an Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Name of the Azure Site Recovery policy.
Replication Provider type.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported: 30, 300 and 900.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot (in hours.)
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
ID of the Azure storage account to replicate to. (This setting will be overriden by the storage account provided during enable replication if one is provided)
Enable encryption at rest for replicated data.
Name of the Azure Site Recovery policy.
Replication Provider type.
Replication Method. Either Online or Offline.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported: 30, 300 and 900.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot (in hours.)
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Port on which replication would take place.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.
Name of the Azure Site Recovery policy.
Replication Provider type.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported: 30, 300 and 900.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot (in hours.)
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
ID of the Azure storage account to replicate to. (This setting will be overriden by the storage account provided during enable replication if one is provided)
Enable encryption at rest for replicated data.
Replication Method. Either Online or Offline.
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Port on which replication would take place.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.

Set recovery properties such as targetnetwork and virtual machine size for a Replication Protected Item
The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryReplicationProtectedItem cmdlet sets the recovery properties for a Replication Protected Item.
Azure Site Recovery Replication Protected Item
Name of the recovery virtual machine
Recovery virtual machine size. Sould be from the set of sizes supported by Azure virtual machines
Network Interface card of the virtual machine for which to set the recovery network property.
ID of the Azure virtual network to recover the Protected Item to.
Name of the Subnet on the recovery Azure virtual network to recover the Protected Item to.
Static IP address that should be assigned to primary NIC on recovery.
Nic properties set by user or set by default. Specify "NotSelected" to go back to the default values.
License Type selection for Windows server virtual machines being migrated using Hybrid use benefit.
Azure Site Recovery Replication Protected Item
Name of the recovery virtual machine
Recovery virtual machine size. Sould be from the set of sizes supported by Azure virtual machines
Network Interface card of the virtual machine for which to set the recovery network property.
ID of the Azure virtual network to recover the Protected Item to.
Name of the Subnet on the recovery Azure virtual network to recover the Protected Item to.
Static IP address that should be assigned to primary NIC on recovery.
Nic properties set by user or set by default. Specify "NotSelected" to go back to the default values.
License Type selection for Windows server virtual machines being migrated using Hybrid use benefit.

Set or update recovery side options for an entity that is being protected to Azure.
The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVM cmdlet lets you set or update recovery side options such as recovery VM size and recovery VM network for entities being protected to Azure.

Target size, should be limited to set of values of Azure VM sizes

Nic properties set by user or set by default

Start the planned failover of an Azure Site Recovery Replication Protected Item or Recovery Plan.
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPlannedFailoverJob cmdlet starts the planned failover of an Azure Site Recovery Replication Protected Item or Recovery Plan.
Protection Entity object
Direction of the failover operation. Either "PrimarytoRecovery" or "RecoverytoPrimary"

This parameter is applicable when Failover is done from Azure to an on-premises site. Specify
ForDowntime: Minimizes downtime by synchronizing changes without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job is suspended. Resume the job to shutdown the virtual machine and perform an additional synchronization before completing the failover
ForSynchronization : Minimizes data synchronization by shutting down the virtual machine before begining data synchronization followed by the failover.
Applicable only for failback operations. The setting specifies that a new virtual machine should be created on the fabric if it is not found.
Azure Site Recovery server on which to create the virtual machine if not found.
Services Provider object of the host on which to create the virtual machine if not found.
Data Encryption Primary Certificate File.
Data Encryption Secondary Certificate File.
Recovery Plan object.
Direction of the failover operation. Either "PrimarytoRecovery" or "RecoverytoPrimary"

This parameter is applicable when Failover is done from Azure to an on-premises site. Specify
ForDowntime: Minimizes downtime by synchronizing changes without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job is suspended. Resume the job to shutdown the virtual machine and perform an additional synchronization before completing the failover
ForSynchronization : Minimizes data synchronization by shutting down the virtual machine before begining data synchronization followed by the failover.
Applicable only for failback operations. The setting specifies that a new virtual machine should be created on the fabric if it is not found.
Azure Site Recovery server on which to create the virtual machine if not found.
Services Provider object of the host on which to create the virtual machine if not found.
Data Encryption Primary Certificate File.
Data Encryption Secondary Certificate File.
Replication Protected Item object.

ForSynchronization : Minimizes data synchronization by shutting down the virtual machine before begining data synchronization followed by the failover.
Applicable only for failback operations. The setting specifies that a new virtual machine should be created on the fabric if it is not found.

Stops an Azure Site Recovery Job.
The Stop-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob stops an Azure Site Recovery Job.
Azure Site Recovery Job object.
Name of the Azure Site Recovery Job.
Azure Site Recovery Job object.
Name of the Azure Site Recovery Job.
Update and Azure site Recovery Policy.
The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicy cmdlet updates and Azure Site Recovery Policy.
Azure Site Recovery Policy object.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported: 30, 300 and 900.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot (in hours.)
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
ID of the Azure storage account to replicate to. (This setting will be overriden by the storage account provided during enable replication if one is provided)
Enable encryption at rest for replicated data.
Azure Site Recovery Policy object.
Replication Method. Either Online or Offline.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported: 30, 300 and 900.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot (in hours.)
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Port on which replication would take place.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.
Azure Site Recovery Policy object.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported: 30, 300 and 900.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot (in hours.)
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
ID of the Azure storage account to replicate to. (This setting will be overriden by the storage account provided during enable replication if one is provided)
Enable encryption at rest for replicated data.
Replication Method. Either Online or Offline.
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Port on which replication would take place.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.
Updates the source and target Fabric for failed over Replication Protected Items or Recovery Plans and starts the replication in the updated direction.

The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionDirection cmdlet updates the source and target Fabric for failed over Replication Protected Items or the Replication Protected Items in a Recovery Plan and starts replication in the updated direction.

Either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary

Either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary

Either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Recovery Plan object
Replication Protected Item object
Update a Recovery Plan.

The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan cmdlet is used to update a Recovery Plan. Specify a Recovery Plan json file to be used to update the Recovery Plan, or use the Edit-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan cmdlet to edit a Recovery Plan before using the Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan to save the Recovery Plan.
Recovery Plan object.
File path to the json file to use to update the Recovery Plan
Recovery Plan object.
File path to the json file to use to update the Recovery Plan
Refresh Server information
Use the Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryServer cmdlet to refresh the information about the Azure Site Recovery Server and related object.
Azure Site Recovery Server
Azure Site Recovery Server
Update the information received from the Azure Site Recovery Services Provider.
Use the Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryServicesProvider cmdlet to trigger a refresh of the information received from the Recovery Services Provider.
